thread.title: Panthers terrorized by 5 a.m. fire alarm pull at Seattle hotel
thread.title_full: Panthers terrorized by 5 a.m. fire alarm pull at Seattle hotel | New York Post

author: Post Wire Report
title: Panthers terrorized by 5 a.m. fire alarm pull at Seattle hotel
text:
SEATTLE — The Carolina Panthers got an unexpectedly early wake-up call Sunday morning when the fire alarm went off at their downtown Seattle hotel prior to their game against the Seahawks.
The Panthers posted a statement on their website saying an alarm “was pulled” around 5:40 a.m. PDT, about 7½ hours prior to kick-off against the Seahawks. The team said players and staff were evacuated from the hotel and by 6 a.m. everyone was given clearance to return to their rooms.
A number of Panthers players tweeted about the alarm. Backup QB Derek Anderson said it was just the Panthers’ floors that were disturbed by the alarm, not the entire hotel.
Just happened to be our floors only.. Guess that's just by chance lol
— Derek Anderson (@DAnderson314) October 18, 2015 
Whoever pulled the fire alarm on the 16th floor….not cool. 👎🏿👎🏿
— Charles Tillman (@peanuttillman) October 18, 2015 
Who pulled the fire alarm…😒 pic.twitter.com/n7Wmv5oShD 
— Graham Gano (@GrahamGano) October 18, 2015 

The irate Panthers want a thorough investigation of the shenanigans.
“Obviously, this is an issue that directly affects our club,” team spokesman Steven Drummond said, according to Pro Football Talk. “We will let the hotel and the League investigate.”
The Panthers (4-0) are trying to reach 5-0 for the second time in franchise history.
With AP 
  carolina panthers ,  nfl ,  seattle seahawks
